content.description: Super Obvious face. There is a great landing built out now for safe falls. Start on two side pulls. Left hand is a pocket, and the right hand is just a basic 1-2 pad side pull. Go up and grab some flat holds, side pulls, pockets, and crimps. Slap some good bulbous top out holds and rock over.
content.location: Same as going to the power wall, but instead of taking a left to go to the power wall, just head straight down and you will see this massive boulder with an obvious face.

content.description: The Pistol Shrimp (Alpheidae) is a crustacean characterized by it's large asymmetrical claw which is capable of snapping shut with extreme force, creating a destructive bubble of hot gas hotter than the surface of the sun.Pistol Shrimp starts on Black Snapper, follows Hammerhead out to the prominent fin, then fires a crux sequence coming out the roof between Hammerhead and Black Snapper.Start matched in a jug deep inside the cave. Trend right following Hammerhead until you’re on underclings near the end of the roof. Slap the sloper at the lip, stabilize on a small ripple crimp, then go big to the final bucket out left. Mantel and drop off.
content.protection: I would want 4 pads if I was alone
content.location: The center of the power wall. This is usually the wettest section of the wall, hence the dark black rock. Finding this line dry can be a challenge during the wet season.

content.description: Start on a low ledge. Work the pinches until the throw!
content.location: On the very right of the roof system that makes up the Power Wall.

content.description: start deep in the cave on the rightward trending juggy flake.  Follow this feature to the lip, hit the good crimp on the face and dunk the finish jug.  Top out.
content.location: second problem you encounter in the cave.  To the right of campus card.

content.description: Starts low on a giant semi-hollow flake and climbs up through crimps, ledges, and finally a few sidepulls to a huge drop-off jug.
content.location: Walk past the power walk around the corner. Continue into the far corner of the next big overhanging section of rock. Starts in front of a large boulder. If you hit the pinch problem you’ve gone too far.

content.description: To the right of black snapper on good right facing jugs under the roof.  Trend rightward out the roof on jugs.  Hit the slopey jug, pull the lip and stand up on the slab.
content.location: Far right side of cave.  Just right of black snapper.  Tops out where the headwall becomes more of a low angle slap.

climbs.name: Dust Off the Ol' China
climbs.fa: If no one else, Cam Wallace, November 2019.

content.description:
Same start as "Always Lead the Opossum." Move up to the first jug and traverse right on excellent hand holds and decent feet. Navigate a wild sequence from the start of "Black Snapper" into the start of "Grope Factor Five" with funky foot beta and strong abs. Work into the two crimps above the corner jug rail on Grope Factor, throw the last of your strength right to hit the final jug on the roof, and end matched on it.

 My buddies and I scoped this line when it was rainy and the whole face of the Power Wall was a waterfall. Ended up being surprisingly flow-y and fun. You could probably keep traversing with some big throws. Could be a bit of a butt-dragger if you're tall.

 Beta video: youtu.be/yNEy5dw3Hew
content.location: Same start as Always Lead the Opossum, and traverse right.

content.description: Climb a jug rail to the lip of the roof. Climb past two bad crimps and a sloper to top it out
content.location: Leftmost route at the Power Wall

content.description: Similar to the other problems at the wall.  Start at the furthest back holds, two close together incuts.  Move out to the big rail and work left to a big move to the lip.  Work up the face to the finish.  Either dyno to the jug or bump up slopey crimps.  Top out.
content.location: About 15 feet right of Michael Jordan, this is the next problem that starts under the roof.

content.description:
This is a great wall just up the road from Fountain Red.  Consists of a deep but not very tall cave with several problems coming out of the cave and up the face to top out. 

  The problems are all very similar and would be many many stars if the cave weren't such an back dragger.
